showScoreExcerpt:
"It’s 20 years since 'Take Me Out' premiered at London’s Donmar Warehouse, played the Public Theater Off-Broadway and then transferred to Broadway where it won the Tony Award for Best Play. But the issues it raises are still sadly relevant. In the two decades since its debut, there have been no openly gay major sports figures and though acceptance is on the rise, there are still homophobic voices raised and laws passed to stop gay topics from being raised in the classroom. There has also been legislation in many states to prevent trans athletes from participating in school sports."
